DataElement.preferredName: Primary Tumor Involvement Superior Mesenteric Vein Or Portal Vein Yes No Not Evaluable Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/not evaluable indicator related to the a benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation that has a connection to the superior mesenteric vein or the portal vein.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Primary Tumor Involvement Superior Mesenteric Vein Or Portal Vein
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value._A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias._To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process._A vein that follows the path of the superior mesenteric artery and joins with the splenic vein to form the hepatic portal vein._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._A short thick trunk vein that transports blood containing the absorbed products of digestion from the intestine directly to the liver.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original. (American Heritage Dictionary):(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.

Concepts.definition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredName: Superior Mesenteric Vein Or Portal Vein Involvement
Property.preferredDefinition: A vein that follows the path of the superior mesenteric artery and joins with the splenic vein to form the hepatic portal vein.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:A short thick trunk vein that transports blood containing the absorbed products of digestion from the intestine directly to the liver.:To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

Concepts.definition: A vein that follows the path of the superior mesenteric artery and joins with the splenic vein to form the hepatic portal vein.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A short thick trunk vein that transports blood containing the absorbed products of digestion from the intestine directly to the liver.
To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/not evaluable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ReferenceDocuments.name: An interface is present betwe
ReferenceDocuments.description: An interface is present between the primary tumor and the superior mesenteric vein or portal vein and measures greater than or equals to 180 degrees of the circumference of the vessel wall
